evidence.title: Florida CJIS Security Policy
evidence.snippet: CJIS-covered video and ALPR captures must maintain documented retention, audit logging, and staff training controls even when vendors manage the storage layer.

evidence.title: Sunshine Law Compliance Checklist
evidence.snippet: Projects that deploy new cameras in university corridors must publish a notice of collection, retention period, and appeal instructions for citizens who contest footage use.

risks.description: Campus-wide ALPR and video coverage are proposed without CJIS-ready retention or operator vetting, creating a high probability of evidence being inadmissible or mishandled.
risks.mitigation: Adopt the FDLE CJIS Security Policy controls, document an incident response plan, and require vendor SOC 2 evidence before ingesting license-plate data.

risks.description: No public engagement plan is described for the Glades Rd and campus-core corridors even though Sunshine Law requires signage and meeting minutes for surveillance expansions.
risks.mitigation: Publish a Sunshine Law packet, include signage mockups in council minutes, and provide an accessible website summarizing sensor coverage.

requirements.description: Create a CJIS-compliant retention and access procedure for all ALPR and evidentiary video stored in the cloud.
Deliver a Sunshine Law outreach package (notices, hearing minutes, signage) before activating new corridor sensors.
